Syriac Chronicle
Syrische Chronik
The First Part of the Chronography

Weltgeschichte
Universal History, Part i.
History of the World
Pars Prima [Chronographiae]
Pars I. Chronicon Patrum, & Regum
bibl.author: Gregorius Bar Hebraeus — ܓܪܝܓܘܪܝܘܣ ܒܪ ܥܒܪܝܐ
bibl.note:
The first part of Bar Hebraeus'
Chronicle
; an account of secular history from the time of Adam until Bar Hebraeus' own time (the 13th century). Through the 12th century, it is largely an abridgement of Michael the Syrian's Chronicle.

This work should be distinguished from the Arabic History of the Dynasties, which reflects a similar structure but has significant differences, including some additions that may be from Islamic sources.

bibl.title: The Chronography of Bar Hebraeus
bibl.note: A facsimile of Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS Huntingdon 52

bibl.title: Ankuendigung und Probe einer neuen kritischen Ausgabe und neuen Uebersetzung der Syrischen Chronik des Gregor Bar-Hebraeus
bibl.note: Contains only the first few pages of the Chronicle.

bibl.title: De rebus gestis Richardi Angliæ regis in Palæstina: Excerptum ex Gregorii Abulpharagii chronico syriaco
bibl.note: Contains a short excerpt from the Chronicle.

bibl.bibl:
Vat. sir. 166 (olim Codd. Orientales, ab Andrea Scandar 24), ff. 1-243v . See Assemani,
338-341
Vat. sir. 383 (= Assemani 126). See Assemani, 48 . This manuscript contains the beginning of the chronicle through the year A.D. 1034 (A.G. 1346).
Vat. sir. 384 (= Assemani 127). See Assemani, 48 . This manuscript is a continuation of Vat. sir. 383, from the years A.D. 1035 (A.G. 1347) to A.D. 1201 (A.G. 1513).
Vat. sir. 385 (= Assemani 128). See Assemani, 48-49 . This manuscript is a continuation of Vat. sir. 384, from the years A.D. 1202 (A.G. 1514) to A.D. 1288 (A.G. 1600).
Firenze BML Or. 366 ( = Assemani, Palat. Medic. 118). See e-corpus and Assemani, Palat. Medic. , 190-197 . Assemani does not mention which folios part 1 comprises.

Vat. sir. 167 (olim Prop. 14),
ff. 1-161 . See Assemani 341-342

bibl.title: The Chronography of Bar Hebraeus
bibl.note: Wilmshurst calls this a clotted English translation ... which has not yet been replaced by anything better.

bibl.title: تاريخ الدول السرياني‮ ‬تاليف ابي‮ ‬الفرج الملطي

bibl.title: تاريخ الزمان
bibl.note: A republication of Ishaq Armalet's translation in al-Mashriq, but starting at Bedjan, page 122 regarding Abū al-ʿAbbās and with an added introduction by Fiey.

bibl.title: Сирийские источники XII-XIII вв. об Азербайджане
Confronto tra il Taʾrīḫ muḫtaṣar ad-duwal e il Chonicon Syriacum di Abū l-Farağ Ibn al-ʿIbrī (Barebreo)
bibl.note: Excerpts of parts corresponding to Bedjan 263.25-408.2 (the period of 1097-1203)
